required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Loss of Resistance, w/wo Stimulation, For Epidural Placement
clinical_study.official_title: Loss of Resistance With Nerve Stimulation Versus Loss of Resistance Alone; Effect on Success of Thoracic Epidural Placement.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this randomized, observer-blinded, investigative trial is to determine if the use of electrical stimulation, compared to the traditional loss of resistance technique alone, improves the success rate of epidural catheter placement at an academic teaching institution.

detailed_description.textblock: All subjects will receive a thoracic epidural catheter placement at the level appropriate for their surgery and will be randomized to either have the epidural placed with a loss of resistance technique alone or loss of resistance technique with confirmation by nerve stimulation. In the traditional loss of resistance technique group, the epidural catheter will be placed after achieving loss of resistance to air. In the electrical stimulation group, following the location of the epidural space with a loss of resistance technique (using air), nerve stimulation will be utilized to elicit a myotomal contraction of the abdominal or thoracic wall. Nerve stimulation will be started at a pulse width of 0.3 ms and a frequency of 1 Hz and a current of 0.2mA.

study_design_info.masking_description: As the patient will be sedated during epidural catheter placement, they will be blinded to their treatment arm. The investigator that determines if the epidural was successful placed will also be blinded to the patient's treatment arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Success Rate of Placement of a Thoracic Epidural
primary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minutes after administration of a test dose of lidocaine
primary_outcome.description: will be determined by the detection of a loss of sensation to cold (ice) in at least two contiguous dermatomal levels, 15 minutes after administration of a test dose of lidocaine through the epidural catheter. If a loss of cold sensation is found, then the epidural placement will be classified as successful. If no loss of cold sensation is found, then the epidural placement will be classified as unsuccessful.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time Required to Place the Epidural Catheter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initiation of procedure to end of procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The time required to place the epidural catheter will be recorded

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Thoracic Spine Levels Attempted
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Thirty minutes after start of procedure.
secondary_outcome.description: the number of thoracic spine levels attempted will be recorded

arm_group.description: In the traditional loss of resistance technique group, the epidural catheter will be placed after achieving loss of resistance to air. After placement of the catheter a standard test dose of 3+2 ml of 1.5% lidocaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine will be administered.Solution for Thoracic epidural block.

In the electrical stimulation group, following the location of the epidural space with a loss of resistance technique (using air), nerve stimulation will be utilized to elicit a myotomal contraction of the abdominal or thoracic wall. After placement of the catheter a standard test dose of 3+2 ml of 1.5% lidocaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine will be administered.Solution for Thoracic epidural block.Thoracic epidural block with Electrical Nerve stimulation

intervention.description: Thoracic epidural block with epidural placed with a loss of resistance technique alone.

In the electrical stimulation group, following the location of the epidural space with a loss of resistance technique (using air), nerve stimulation will be utilized to elicit a myotomal contraction of the abdominal or thoracic wall.stimulating peripheral nerve catheters(19 Ga. x 90 cm StimuCath® Continuous Nerve Block Catheter with SnapLock™ Adapter (Arrow by Teleflex Medical, Morrisville, NC), and stimulation will be achieved using a B Braun Stimuplex HNS12 Nerve Stimulator product id 4892098.
Dose of 3+2 ml of 1.5% lidocaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults undergoing intra-thoracic or intra-abdominal procedures that normally would receive thoracic epidurals for post-operative analgesia will be eligible.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with contraindications to regional anesthesia:
- history of allergy to amide local anesthetics
- presence of a progressive neurological deficit
- patients that are on anticoagulant medications that prohibit placement of an epidural
- Systemic infection
- Infection at the site of placement

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
